holidays.name: National Milk Chocolate Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the sweet, creamy delight of milk chocolate! Indulge in a bar, bake it into desserts, or just savor the smooth, melty goodness that has delighted chocoholics for generations.
holidays.origin: While the exact origin date is uncertain, this day celebrates the invention of milk chocolate by Daniel Peter in 1875, who combined cocoa with powdered milk to create the world’s first milk chocolate bar.
holidays.funFact: Milk chocolate wasn't popular until the invention of conching by Rodolphe Lindt in 1879, which made it smooth and melt-in-your-mouth delicious!

holidays.name: World Nature Conservation Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the importance of protecting our natural world and the rich biodiversity that sustains life on Earth. Perfect for tree-huggers and environmentalists!
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations to promote harmony between humans and nature and encourage sustainable development.
holidays.funFact: Deforestation accounts for about 15% of global greenhouse gas emissions, making conservation crucial in combating climate change.

holidays.name: Tau Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration for math enthusiasts who argue that τ (tau), approximately 6.28, is a more natural and useful circle constant than π (pi)!
holidays.origin: Created by math lovers who believe that tau (τ = 2π) should replace pi as the fundamental circle constant because it relates directly to the circumference of a circle.
holidays.funFact: Tau advocates claim using τ simplifies many formulas, such as the unit circle, making math both easier and more fun!

holidays.name: Father-in-Law Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek holiday to appreciate the often mysterious, sometimes intimidating, but always special father-in-law in your life. Show some love, or share a funny story!
holidays.origin: An unofficial observance created by internet communities to honor the unique role fathers-in-law play in families.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that good relationships with in-laws can boost family happiness and reduce stress — so maybe send a card!
